summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing aircraft linked to Jeffrey Epstein. It reveals two Epstein-owned companies (Plan D LLC and Hyperion Air LLC) and specific aircraft registrations, including a Gulfstream jet and a helicopter. The emails show law enforcement sharing information about the aircraft's recent movements and ownership structure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the owner of companies (Plan D LLC, Hyperion Air LLC) that registered aircraft N212JE and N331JE. The emails discuss tracking his aircraft.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Mentioned in open-source reporting as having been a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein, according to information included in the email chain.

connections.description: Visoski is identified in open-source reporting as having been a pilot for Epstein.

events.title: Aircraft flight from Paris to Teterboro
events.description: Flight plan indicates aircraft N212JE operated from Paris, France to Teterboro, New Jersey.

events.title: Aircraft flight from Teterboro to Brunswick
events.description: Flight plan indicates aircraft N212JE operated from Teterboro, New Jersey to Brunswick, Georgia (KBQK).

events.title: Email sharing aircraft information
events.description: An email is sent identifying another Epstein-linked aircraft (Bell 430 helicopter N331JE) and providing a picture.

events.title: Email confirmation of Epstein companies
events.description: An email confirms that Plan D LLC and Hyperion Air LLC are Jeffrey Epstein companies.

locations: Cobb County airport (KRYY) in Kennesaw, Georgia
San Juan division (implied Puerto Rico/Virgin Islands area)
keyFacts: Two companies, Plan D LLC and Hyperion Air LLC, both based in St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, are identified as Jeffrey Epstein companies used to register aircraft.

Aircraft N212JE (a Gulfstream GV-SP) was tracked flying from Paris to Teterboro, NJ on July 7, 2019, and then to Brunswick, GA on July 11, 2019, and was reportedly located in a hangar at Cobb County airport in Georgia in August 2019.
Another Epstein-linked aircraft, a Bell 430 helicopter with tail number N331JE, was identified in the correspondence.
Open-source reporting indicated Larry Visoski was a pilot for Epstein.
The email chain shows active information sharing about Epstein's assets among law enforcement personnel in August 2019, shortly after his arrest.
